page.title: 17Hellifield Railway Station
page.content: The dark entrance to the curving subway is roofed with iron girders. Thin black cracks, oozing mud, line the once white tiles. The station platform, silent and deserted, is covered with a slanting glass roof. Every red rusty pillar says M.R. for Midland Railway. Lacey patterns of wrought iron are a playground for flying wyverns. All the doors and windows of the station are boarded up. The old loading bays are piled up with rubbish and partly hidden by weeds and trees. A haze of purple lupins is all that marks where the old loco sheds were. A train comes. The engine noise rises to a shriek. The platform shakes and wobbles like a jelly. Several carriages flash past, clickety-clack, clickety-clack. Then it is gone. The station returns to its quiet dreams.
